SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class MidGameManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.GameManager
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.MidGameManager
public class MidGameManager extends GameManager
The MidGameManager class is responsible for managing the game flow during the mid-phase of the game.
It extends the GameManager class and provides specific behavior for the mid-phase.

This class overrides methods from the GameManager class to provide custom behavior for the mid-phase.
It includes methods for dragging tiles to the bookshelf, registering players during reconnection, verifying game conditions, and setting the next current player.

Since:
27/04/2023
Version:
6.0
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

  • Method Details

    • dragTilesToBookShelf

      public void dragTilesToBookShelf(ClientInterface user, List<Coordinate> chosenTiles, int chosenColumn)
      Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses.
      Allows dragging tiles to the bookshelf. This method allows the user to drag tiles to the bookshelf. It verifies the validity of the chosen tiles and updates the game state accordingly.
      Specified by:
      dragTilesToBookShelf in class GameManager
      Parameters:
      user - the client interface of the user
      chosenTiles - the list of coordinates representing the chosen tiles
      chosenColumn - the chosen column in the bookshelf
      See Also:
      • ClientInterface
      • Coordinate

    • registerPlayer

      public void registerPlayer(ClientInterface user, String nickname)
      Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses. Registers a player with the specified nickname and view. This method is called when a player tries to register during reconnection. If the player is successfully reconnected, their virtual view is updated and their state is changed to connected.
      Specified by:
      registerPlayer in class GameManager
      Parameters:
      user - the client interface of the user
      nickname - the nickname of the player
      See Also:
      • ClientInterface

      private void verifyCommonGoal(ClientInterface user)
      Verifies the common goal for a player. This method checks if the player has achieved the conditions specified by the common goal.

    • verifyFinalGame

      private void verifyFinalGame(ClientInterface user)
      Verifies the final game conditions for a player. This method checks if the player's bookshelf is full, indicating the end of the game. If the bookshelf is full, the player's score is updated, and the game state is set to GameState.FINAL.
      Parameters:
      user - The user for whom to verify the final game conditions.
